text: hi everyone bigfoot lee tano here the
internet
is
music nerd and it's time for a review of
this new hot chip album freak out
release this is the eighth full-length
lp from long running uk synth pop and
electro pop outfit hot chip which comes
a few years after the record a bath full
of ecstasy and album that really failed
to stop me in my tracks so much so that
i didn't even do a formal full review of
it i was hoping that freakout release
would be a different story especially
given some of the bold singles leading
up to it down for example i think is one
of hot chips catchiest and most
disco-infused tracks yet the tight drum
work on this track is fantastic as are
those very hyper frames of girl know how
to break it down the production is lush
groovy colorful the performance
energetic but not too wild i like how
every once in a while hot chip really
nails that balance of the polite banger
then there's the title track which may
be the most biting single the band's
ever released with all of its distorted
robot vocals and very heavy very
aggressive synth riffs that resemble
that of like a metal song hot chip has
never sounded so sinister sonically but
also lyrically with calls of wild beast
freak out release black teeth freak out
release these cuts make for a very
promising first leg of the lp as does
the bittersweet blend of synth funk and
electro pop on eleanor the
heart-wrenching broken as well is one of
the most touching songs i think the band
has ever worked out it's a vulnerable
ballad about feeling broken and
emotionally dysfunctional maybe in your
own mind ready to cope with uh hardships
but uh instead falling short and knowing
that you're not really there the pumping
edm style choruses which are very
nuanced and subtle uh transition
fantastically and gradually from these
very melodic and barebones verses so
these tracks are all great love these
tracks but the blandness of this lp
begins to set in around the midpoint as
yeah the excitement really does take a
nosedive there's not alone which is a
very stiff and breathy ballad that
makes me feel like i am hanging out in a
museum in the metaverse staring at
soulless pieces of ai-generated art and
while the tracks lyrics about sadness
and isolation do hit i wish that these
feelings came out more in the vocal
performance and the instrumental the
awkwardness of hard to be funky i'm not
all that crazy about two it's a bit of a
tough pill to swallow with lyrics like
hard to feel sexy when you're not very
funky which i get adds to a general
sentiment about having a difficulty
connecting with human emotions due to a
numbness or an awkwardness something
like that but again i wouldn't call the
lyrical descriptions of this sensation
all that impressive plus i think lou
hater on the back end is a good addition
to the cut it definitely makes for a
stronger finish but in a sense it's kind
of too little too late if only her
inclusions had been peppered throughout
the track to kind of bring up the energy
level from here the record continues to
lose flavor and steam miss the bliss is
really more bland than it is blissful
nor does it sound as dark and in the
dumps as the chorus would imply too then
there's the evil that men do which in a
sense i do appreciate the attempt on
this track of making a grand statement
about the topic stated in the title but
i'm not really sure about the rap tie-in
toward the end with a canadian rap
veteran cadence weapon this part almost
reads like a forced meaningful
macklemore type moment i mean maybe not
as tacky but still clearly operating in
that lane there were really only two
spots in the second half that left a
super positive impression on me one of
them being time which is kind of like a
very cerebral john hopkins-esque house
track with lots of subtle driving beats
very serene droning synths the chorus
builds in a kind of anthemic way though
i wish the vocals kind of carried things
further passion wise then the closing
track i found kind of interesting
especially with its vocal harmonies at
the start carrying lyrics that read like
positive self affirmations which backs
up some of the selfies themes of
self-love and preservation
self-sufficiency and care there's
something very english about the wording
of these lyrics and some of the
harmonies as well reads like some very
early new wave especially as we
transition into this pulsating second
half with a lot of old school
synth mayhem going on overall i thought
this lp was a pretty mixed bag i was
hoping for a stronger showing from hot
chip this time around especially given
how underwhelming their last record was
but despite some great singles there
were way more snoozers in the track list
here than
i was anticipating and sadly overall i
don't think the record comes together
all that well in terms of these songs
having a guiding sonic theme or
direction or really that much of a
lyrical theme or direction either so not
only are a lot of the songs on this lp
bland i don't think they come together
all that cohesively too yeah there are a
handful of good cuts here but outside of
that this lp is very very very
underwhelming and okay at best i'm
feeling a strong five to a light six on
this one tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should i review next hit the like if you
like please subscribe and please don't
cry hit the bell as well over here next
to my head is another video you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel anthony fantano
hot chip
forever
